intro: Chamaeanthus sarcanthoides, commonly known as the red-flowered rock heath, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It features dense clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are adapted to withstand arid conditions and full sun exposure. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a distinctive and visually striking species in its native environment.
